intro: Bomarea brachysepala, commonly known as the short-sepaled bomarea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaryllidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
